ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: First order equations via method of characteristics, Laplace's equation and harmonic functions, Fourier series/transform methods, heat and wave equations, then a more general discussion of hyperbolic equations.
I learned about the method of characteristics, Laplace's equation, the Wave Equation, and some techniques from fourier analysis and sobolev spaces

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Very well organized and effectively communicated big picture ideas. The problem sets/midterm were all very good and tied in with the course very well.
I loved this coursethe lectures were great, and the homework sets & tests were well designed. Professor Schlag is wonderful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. It contexualizes everything from intro analysis classes and lays the foundation to effectively study PDE's.
Yes! This course made me much more interested in analysis and really helped me understand interesting concepts as well as gain confidence with technical tools
